definition: lit. peddlers and carriers/common people/lower class
to deal in/to buy and sell/to trade in/to retail/to peddle
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
soldier/servant/to finish/to die/finally/at last/pawn in Chinese chess

sentences.english: His disciples were fishermen and common people.
sentences.chinese: 他的门徒都是一些渔夫和贩夫走卒。

definition: high official and noble persons (idiom); the great and the good

the Three Religions (Daoism, Confucianism, Buddhism) and Nine Schools (Confucians, Daoists, Yin-Yang, Legalists, Logicians, Mohists, Political Strategists, Eclectics, Agriculturists)/fig. people from all trades (often derog.)
poor people (idiom)/those who live from hand to mouth
marketplace/town/the street (urban milieu)/the haunts of the common people
all the trades/people of all trades and professions
"the four classes" of ancient China, i.e. scholars, farmers, artisans, and merchants
